page.title: 17Hussey's Bakery
page.content: Originally Hussey's was the village bakery (map ref 554.613) of Ashford Hill. It now supplies bread and cakes to a wide surrounding area including Basingstoke. Fifteen vans deliver bread to shops and factories. In addition fresh cream cakes,doughnuts and cakes for special occasions are made (Christmas etc.).There are seven steam ovens and the workers do two shifts- night and day. The most popular loaf is known as a Bloomer and the most popular cake is the Lardy. Flour is delivered once a week and comes from Rank-Hovis-MacDougall.
